channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024071093
item.description:
Report X-2024071093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment consisted of four one-gallon plastic bottles of the Betco Delimer descaler #248. Out of the four bottles, three were dented on their surfaces, out of those three one of them had leaked from the cap being finger loose and not completely sealed.

Report X-2024071244

  • City: SAN PABLO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTICED A STRONG SMELL COMING FROM PACKAGE, LEFT AREA AND NOTIFY SUPERVISOR, RESPONDER WAS CALL TO WORK AREA, ONCE IT WWAS DERERMINED SMELL WAS TOO STRONG TO ENTER, AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CALLED. TRAILER WAS PLACED ON PAD 179 UNTIL THE OUTSIDE REPONDER ARRIVED AT 5:15PM.

  • City: ANAHEIM

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD AT DOOR 57 ON THE FLOOR USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS UP RIGHT MINOR CLEAN UP, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED THERE BY EMPLOYEE IN THE UNLOAD, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE AND OPENED UP, THERE WERE 4-1 GALLLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS , PRODUCT NAME DIVERSEY SUMA NOVA L6 MECHANICAL DISH DETERGENT, ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP, PROCESSED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP

item.title: Report X-2024071110
item.description:
Report X-2024071110

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was discovered by a manager in the load side. The package was wet and had torn from the bottom which allowed the bottles to slip out of the package. 1/4 bottles of stain remover had its cap come loose which caused a leak inside the package. When I arrived at the site, I picked up the package and its contents and placed in on my cart on top of some absorbent pads to be taken away to be processed elsewhere, then I dried the wet area with some additional pads.

item.title: Report X-2024071137
item.description:
Report X-2024071137

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 806028 in a wet state, package was placed in a tote for QA inspection, upon analysis, contents is a bottle of sink and surface cleaner sanitizer that had a loose cap from movement, which cause its liquid content to spill out. A secure cap or better packing inside will help prevent cap from getting loose.

item.title: Report E-2024070423
item.description:
Report E-2024070423

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and a 10ft-by-10ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due improper packaging. Clean Harbors personnel deployed absorbents and then swept up the released material. The damaged drums were overpacked into three (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The recovered material and spent absorbents were placed into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums and two (2) 30-gallon poly drums and were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024070420
item.description:
Report E-2024070420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1- pound of Phycomycin SCP released from one (1) 50-pound plastic bag due to being ripped by a sharp piece of wood from the pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal and it was determined a contractor would be dispatched to assist with cleanup. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that one (1) pound of material was released due to a bag being punctured by a sharp piece of wood from a pallet. Clean Harbors personnel swept up the released material. The damaged bag and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization

item.title: Report E-2024070398
item.description:
Report E-2024070398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift incident, approximately 3 gallons of Kitchen Knight II (hazardous - UN3266) was released. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 3 gallons of product released affecting a 20’x3’ area on the concrete floor, trailer floor and trailer bay. The contractor collected and containerized the Kitchen Knight II and all clean-up debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 30-gallon drum. All waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024071126
item.description:
Report X-2024071126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET ON TOP AND TORN OPEN. DAMAGED DURING SORTATION. PACKAGE MAY HAVE BEEN PLACED UPSIDE DOWN. ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM TIGHT CAP AND DEFECTIVE SEAL. 4/10THS OF A GALLON LOSS. SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND WHISK BROOM WITH DUST PAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024071091
item.description:
Report X-2024071091

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD CRUSHED AND LEAKING WHITE POWDER. PACKAGE DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. NOT ENOUGH PROTECTIVE INTERNAL PACKAGING. SOLID POWDER POOL CHEM LEAKED FROM DRUM DUE TO TRAVEL VIBRATION. 1 POUND OF MATERIAL LOSS. SPILL COLLECTED WITH WHISK BROOM AND DUST PAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024070330
item.description:
Report E-2024070330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3286 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. GES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070312
item.description:
Report E-2024070312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 6, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3109 was damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the loading dock and tote. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Approximately 30-gallons of UN3267 were hand pumped into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted material were containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The crew pumped the virgin product into one (1) new tote for continued shipment.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: OCEANSIDE

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging was wet and torn on all sides. Discoloration on the box is everywhere that the box is wet. Inside are 2 boxes. 1 is a 3 pack box of 121 fl oz plastic bottles of CloroxPro Germicidal Bleach Concentrate, and the other contains 1 bottle of the same product. Total of 4. All of the bottles have dents on the body and caused a crack where the contents leaked out of.

item.title: Report X-2024070991
item.description:
Report X-2024070991

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon inspection it was found that the package was wet from the top after being tipped over. It was discovered that the package contained 2 hazardous bottles (rapicidepa part a) and 2 nonhazardous bottles (rapicidepa part b). It was found that one of the part b bottles had a loose cap resulting in the leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024070030
item.description:
Report E-2024070030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: SOUTH GATE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to four (4) crushed 5-gallon plastic pails. The damaged plastic pails were placed into one (1) 30-gallon and one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to gather the spent material. The contractor placed the recovered spent absorbents into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. One (1) 55-gallon poly drum was generated containing impacted pallet pieces. One (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum was generated for the contractor’s PPE. All waste generated from this response was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for J.B. Hunt contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: It was reported that 5-pounds of Treflan TR-10 was released from one (1) 1000-pound super sack due to a small hole on the side of the sack. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they would tape-up, re-wrap, and sweep up the spill and place the contents into a 15-gallon poly drum for disposal.
